long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
AI Prompt Manager Browser Extension for Chrome

Easily save, view, and export all your AI prompts for ChatGPT, Claude AI, and Gemini—automatically!

What Does AI Prompt Manager Do?

AI Prompt Manager is a powerful and simple tool designed for anyone using conversational AI tools. As soon as you type a prompt in ChatGPT, Claude AI, or Gemini, the extension automatically saves it in real-time. You can then view, manage, and export your prompts whenever needed—no extra effort required!

Key Features:

Automatic Prompt Saving: Every prompt you type is saved automatically when the extension is enabled—no need to manually track your inputs.

Cross-Platform Compatibility: Works seamlessly with ChatGPT, Claude AI, and Gemini, categorizing your prompts by the chatbot used.

View Saved Prompts: See your saved prompts anytime in a convenient popup window.

Export Options: Download your prompts as JSON or CSV files, complete with:
Category: The chatbot you used (e.g., ChatGPT, Claude AI, Gemini).
Date Stamp: When the prompt was saved.
Text Section: The content of your prompt.

Clear Saved Prompts: Clean your saved data easily with a single click if needed.

Incognito Mode Support: Want to save prompts while in incognito mode? You can enable the feature in your extension settings (requires manual activation).

Why Use AI Prompt Manager?

Save Time and Effort: Never lose a prompt or waste time copying and pasting between tools again.

Stay Organized: Automatically categorized prompts ensure you always know which chatbot was used.

Free to Use: The extension is completely free, with no hidden costs. However, donations are welcome to support development—links to donate can be found in the dropdown menu and the Manage Prompts page.

How to Get Started:

 - Install the extension.
 - Use ChatGPT, Claude AI, or Gemini as you normally would. The extension will 
   automatically save every prompt.
 - Click on the extension icon to view saved prompts.
 - Export your data as JSON or CSV, or clear prompts if no longer needed.

Incognito Mode:

To enable prompt saving in incognito mode, go to the extension’s settings in Chrome, navigate to "Details," and turn on "Allow in Incognito."
